title: Looking for Fonts inspired by older fonts...
content:
Hi, I’m looking for fonts that were inspired by/ derivatives of older fonts such as Arial, Baskerville, Bembo, Helvetica, Univers for a font encyclopedia kind of book we are writing. can anyone help?  
Does anyone know of a website that could tell me?  
Thanks!

 [‹ Clifford...Really??](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44517 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type Battle! Week 3 (1/30) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/battle03 "Go to next forum topic")
author: BlackDog_Publishing

comments.content:
Click on Resources (top right), go to Typography 101 and see that about all of the fonts Jonathan Hoefler presents as examples for different type styles are inspired by/revivals of older typefaces.

BTW, Arial is already “inspired by” Helvetica.
Read the books _Anatomy of a Typeface_ and, if you can find a copy, _Revival of the Fittest_.

Thanks, Typography 101 was really interesting.

Im progressing slowly but wondering if anyone knows of any fonts derived from/ inspired by:

Didot  
Clarendon  
Bodoni  
Joanna  
Sabon  
Rockwell  
Franklin Gothic  
Perpetua  
Courier  
Eurostile

I have now worked out the chronology of the 50 fonts im researching so have decided these older fonts are likely to be the inspiration behind more modern fonts.  
Thanks!

For the first three (at least), one would have to ask: Which one?  
They are that old and classic, one can refer to these terms rather as a certain style/stylistic period than a definite typeface. Nevertheless, a few (arbitrary) links.

[Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Didot) → [Didot Elder](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/typographica.org/000815.php), [H&FJ Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100004), [FF Acanthus](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=FF+Acanthus), [Prillwitz](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/preusstype/prillwitz/)  
 [Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Bodoni) → [ITC Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/itcbodoni.html), [LTC Bodoni 26](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-bodoni-26/), …  
 [Clarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Clarendon) → Egizio, [Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/farao/), [Clarendon Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/clarendon-text/), [Zalderdash](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/zalderdash/), …  
 [Courier](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Courier) → [Courier Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Courier+Sans/Regular/About+this+Font/)

[Sabon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Sabon) itself is a reinterpretation; [Tschichold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Jan%252BTschichold)’s take on [Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Garamond).
Florian, you should add Ambroise to you Didot line of thought.

Tiffany:  
I reckon I should/one could add another few dozens … :-)  
As soon as I started, I realised how futile this had to be. I now rather like Nick’s suggestion (Identifont), or any other compilation that could work as a typeface thesaurus, be it a website feature (like MyFonts’ ‘More Fonts Like This’) or a book (like the famous [FontBook](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/FontBook), with its numerous crosslinks).
